KEY VARIABLE: Machine Speed | DRV39
DEFINITION: The speed at which the paper machine operates, measured in feet per minute (FPM). It directly influences production rates, product quality, and profitability. Optimal speed depends on factors like moisture levels, refining, and drying capacity. The machine is designed for up to 2500 FPM but has occasionally reached 2600 FPM.

KEY VARIABLE: Production Rate TPH
DEFINITION: The tons of paper produced per hour, dependent on reel speed, basis weight, and paper width. It influences steam, chemical, and water consumption, impacting profitability. Typically, production is maintained between 30-35 TPH, with a focus on optimizing drying efficiency to increase throughput.

KEY VARIABLE: Now BW | FR1_BW1_CURV:ROUT
DEFINITION: The weight of paper measured in pounds per thousand square feet, including moisture content (typically 8%). Higher basis weight reduces speed due to limited drying capacity. It is controlled via a feedback loop and machine chest pump to maintain optimal sheet strength while maximizing production efficiency.

KEY VARIABLE: 3rd Dryer Section Pressure Control | PIC-2367-120
DEFINITION: Regulates steam pressure in the third dryer section, affecting drying efficiency and paper quality. Controlled automatically based on moisture set points from the QCS scanner, ensuring optimal drying without exceeding safety limits (max 72 psi). Lowering pressure can improve machine speed while maintaining sheet integrity.

KEY VARIABLE: TAPPI Drying Rate-32 Cans
DEFINITION: Measures the efficiency of water evaporation from the drying cans, calculated in pounds of water evaporated per square foot per hour. An ideal target is 6.0 lbs/sqft-hr. Drying efficiency depends on refining, drainage, and press section water removal, with cleanliness of dryer surfaces also playing a crucial role.

KEY VARIABLE: Stock Storage Tower Level Indication | LI-2180-101
DEFINITION: Indicates the stock preparation system's stability, with levels ideally maintained above 70%. Fluctuations reflect changes in machine speed or stock preparation issues. Consistent levels ensure smooth mill operations, preventing unnecessary water loss and maintaining stock quality.

KEY VARIABLE: Stock Production | TPH (TPH)
DEFINITION: Measures the tonnage of stock processed per hour, calculated from pulper dump pump consistency and cleaner accept flows. Influences overall mill production, requiring proper bale loading and pump maintenance. Stable stock production is essential for maintaining machine efficiency and paper quality.

KEY VARIABLE: Primary Coarse Screen Accepts Flow Control | FFIC-2024-112
DEFINITION: Regulates stock flow from the primary coarse screen, influencing up to 65% of production. Controlled by differential pressure between inlet and accept flow, ensuring efficient separation of contaminants. Optimal flow is maintained around 3750 GPM to support smooth mill operation.

KEY VARIABLE: Secondary Coarse Screen Accepts Flow | FI-2017-203B
DEFINITION: Handles approximately 35% of stock production, influencing overall stock storage levels. Governed by feed pressure and differential pressure, with reject handling crucial to preventing blockages. Proper dilution and feed pump control are essential for maintaining steady stock preparation rates.

KEY VARIABLE: SEC For Refiners (New)
DEFINITION: Measures the specific energy consumption (SEC) in refining, impacting fiber structure and sheet strength. Optimal SEC is between 22-26 kWh/ton, balancing fiber fibrillation and energy efficiency. Over-refining can degrade sheet quality and increase steam consumption due to excessive fines.

KEY VARIABLE: Refiner recirc %
DEFINITION: Represents the proportion of refined stock recirculated back to the refiner feed pump. Kept below 10% to prevent drainage issues, excessive steam consumption, and machine slowdowns. Initially maintained at 17-20%, but later optimized to 8-10% for improved efficiency.

KEY VARIABLE: Refiner No.1 kW/hr | JIC-2123-211
DEFINITION: Tracks the electrical energy applied to Refiner #1, typically between 750-950 kWh. Higher power leads to finer fiber fibrillation but can reduce sheet strength if overused. Monitoring power consumption ensures optimal refining efficiency without excessive fiber cutting.

KEY VARIABLE: Refiner No.2 kW/hr | JIC-2123-221
DEFINITION: Measures the power used by Refiner #2, maintained between 500-600 kWh. Functions similarly to Refiner #1, balancing energy input with fiber development. Excessive refining can degrade fiber strength, reducing overall paper quality.

KEY VARIABLE: Refiners #1 Outlet Flow Control PV | FFIC-2123-242
DEFINITION: Controls the consistency of refined stock flowing to the blend chest. Ensures stable refining conditions to maintain sheet quality. Variations in flow can lead to uneven refining, impacting sheet strength and production stability.

KEY VARIABLE: Refiners #2 Outlet Flow Control PV | FFIC-2123-243
DEFINITION: Similar to Refiner #1, this regulates the outflow from Refiner #2. Maintaining consistent flow is essential for even refining and avoiding variability in sheet formation. Sudden fluctuations can cause defects and operational inefficiencies.

KEY VARIABLE: QCS | RCT | Avg
DEFINITION: Ring Crush Test (RCT) measures the sheet’s strength in the cross-direction, determining box stacking ability. Influenced by basis weight, rush drag, and refining parameters. Maintaining optimal RCT ensures structural integrity of the final product.

KEY VARIABLE: QCS | Bone Dry Last Scan | Avg (lbs/msf)
DEFINITION: Represents the dry weight of the paper excluding moisture content. Controlled via stock flow adjustments from the machine chest. Combined with moisture targets, it determines final sheet basis weight.

KEY VARIABLE: Rush Drag Current | HBVOITH1:RDCR
DEFINITION: A key parameter affecting fiber orientation in the sheet. ‘Rushing’ increases cross-direction strength (RCT), while ‘dragging’ enhances machine direction strength (Concora). Managed through headbox jet-to-wire speed adjustments.

KEY VARIABLE: Wet Suction Box No.1 Sep Outlet Pressure Control Valve | PIC-2166-204B
DEFINITION: Regulates vacuum pressure in the first Fourdrinier suction box, crucial for sheet formation. Excessive vacuum can lead to sheet sealing, reducing drainage efficiency. Proper control ensures smooth dewatering and optimal sheet strength.

KEY VARIABLE: QCS | CONCORA | Avg
DEFINITION: A measure of paper strength tested by compressing fluted strips. Influenced by headbox operations, dragging ratio, and refining intensity. Higher Concora values improve box performance under load.

KEY VARIABLE: Headbox Stilling Chamber Pressure Indication | PI-2362-430
DEFINITION: Measures the pressure in the headbox after high and low consistency stocks are mixed. Proper pressure ensures smooth stock flow and consistent sheet quality. Variations can indicate stock instability or headbox issues.

KEY VARIABLE: Average Headbox Differential Pressure Indication | PDI-2362-440 (psi )
DEFINITION: Monitors the difference between low consistency header pressure and stilling chamber pressure. Proper differential pressure prevents backflow and ensures uniform stock distribution. High differential can reduce Concora values.

KEY VARIABLE: PM Dilution Screen Accepts Pressure Indication | PI-2123-102
DEFINITION: Indicates pressure at the low consistency dilution header, crucial for stock dilution and sheet consistency. Lower pressure optimizes Concora performance. Controlled via pressure transmitters and screen differential adjustments.

KEY VARIABLE: Suction Pick Up Roll-Holding Zones Pres Ctrl | PIC-2365-490
DEFINITION: Monitors vacuum levels at the pick-up roll, affecting refining intensity and sheet consolidation. Higher vacuum can lead to over-refining and increased drying costs. Balanced control ensures optimal dewatering.

KEY VARIABLE: Second Press Draw (fpm)
DEFINITION: Measures the speed differential between the first and second press sections, affecting sheet stretchability and strength. Excessive draw can weaken the sheet and cause breaks. Optimal draw prevents wrinkles while preserving strength.

KEY VARIABLE: Rejects Collection  Tank Level  Control  | LIC-2017-507
DEFINITION: Maintains the level of the rejects collection tank to prevent overflows and process contamination. Collects rejects from multiple sources, ensuring effective water recovery while minimizing re-entry of contaminants.

KEY VARIABLE: Mill Basin Level Indication | LI-2005-501 (%)
DEFINITION: Indicates water levels in the mill basin, which collects process overflows. Proper control ensures efficient water reuse and prevents excess discharge to external treatment facilities. Rising levels may indicate process inefficiencies.

KEY VARIABLE: Average Clear Water Storage Tank Overflow Flow  Control | FIC-2035-702
DEFINITION: Manages excess clean water in the storage tank, diverting it to external treatment only when necessary. Minimizes biological oxygen demand by prioritizing clean water discharge over cloudy water.

KEY VARIABLE: Effluent Clarifier Inlet  Flow Control | FIC-2005-504
DEFINITION: Regulates the flow of effluent water into the clarifier for sludge removal and water recovery. Ensures minimal water discharge and efficient separation of suspended solids.

KEY VARIABLE: MSD Effluent Discharge East | FI-3072 (gpm)
DEFINITION: Measures water discharged to external treatment facilities, tracked in gallons per minute. Controlled to minimize environmental impact while optimizing mill water reuse.

KEY VARIABLE: Headbox Static Head Control | PIC-2362-407
DEFINITION: Maintains headbox pressure through fan pump speed adjustments. Proper pressure ensures consistent stock flow and optimal sheet formation. Calculated based on slice opening, wire speed, and jet-to-wire speed.

KEY VARIABLE: Headbox Dilution Distribution Pipe Pressure Indication | PI-2362-431
DEFINITION: Monitors low consistency header pressure for stock dilution. Must be maintained above high consistency pressure for effective dilution. Affects sheet quality and machine direction fiber orientation.

KEY VARIABLE: Headbox Flow | HBVOITH1:QTOT
DEFINITION: Represents stock flow through the headbox nozzle, calculated using static head and slice opening. Ensures consistent stock delivery for optimal sheet formation.

KEY VARIABLE: Dilution Header Flow Ratio Control | FFIC-2362-406
DEFINITION: Controls dilution flow ratio relative to PM dilution screen accepts flow. Regulated via pump speed, typically between 11.5%-12.5%, ensuring consistent stock consistency.

KEY VARIABLE: Uhle box total flow
DEFINITION: Measures total water removed by vacuum boxes on press felts. Ensures effective water removal, maintaining felt dryness for efficient sheet pressing. Regular felt maintenance is essential for optimal performance.

KEY VARIABLE: Pickup felt Uhle flow
DEFINITION: Tracks water removal from the pickup felt, critical for initial sheet dewatering. Flow decreases as felt ages, necessitating regular maintenance. Proper flow ensures minimal water transfer to subsequent sections.

KEY VARIABLE: 2nd Top Felt Uhle Box Flow | FI-2336-131
DEFINITION: Monitors water removal from the second top press felt. Controlled by vacuum intensity, with flow decreasing as the felt wears. Optimal flow prevents sheet crushing and production slowdowns.

KEY VARIABLE: Uhle box Collection Tank Compartment #3 Level indication
DEFINITION: Measures water removal from the second bottom press felt. Flow rates decrease with felt wear, shifting dewatering to the press nip. Proper control ensures efficient drying and reduced machine slowdowns.

KEY VARIABLE: 2nd Press Nip Dewatering
DEFINITION: Tracks water removed at the press nip through grooves in the Nipco P roll. Increases as felts age, complementing uhle box dewatering. Essential for maintaining solids consistency entering the dryer section.

KEY VARIABLE: QCS | TSI MD/CD AL | Avg
DEFINITION: Measures fiber alignment in the machine (MD) and cross (CD) directions. A higher MD/CD ratio indicates more machine direction fibers, improving Concora. Lower ratios enhance cross-direction strength (RCT).

KEY VARIABLE: Step Foil Box No.3 Sep Outlet Press Control | PIC-2166-214B
DEFINITION: Controls vacuum pressure at the step foil box to balance sheet turbulence and drainage. Excessive pressure can seal the sheet, reducing drainage efficiency. Proper control ensures consistent sheet formation.

KEY VARIABLE: First Press Draw % (%)
DEFINITION: Monitors speed differential between wire turning and pickup rolls. Ensures smooth sheet transfer while preventing weak points and sheet breaks. Typically maintained between 2-7 FPM.

KEY VARIABLE: After Dryer Draw % (%)
DEFINITION: Measures speed difference between the fourth dryer section and after-dryers. Ensures controlled sheet tension, preventing breaks. Proper draw management maintains fiber orientation and sheet elasticity.

KEY VARIABLE: QCS | SCT | Avg
DEFINITION: Short Span Compression Test (SCT) evaluates edgewise compressive strength, critical for box stacking performance. Controlled by moisture levels and fiber orientation. Optimal SCT improves box strength and durability.

KEY VARIABLE: steam per ton
DEFINITION: Measures steam usage per ton of paper produced, monitored to optimize drying efficiency and reduce costs. High steam consumption indicates process inefficiencies. Target is 2800-2980 lbs/ton.

KEY VARIABLE: Tertiary Fine Screen Dilution Flow Transmitter  | FIC-2017-543
DEFINITION: Dilutes stock in the tertiary fine screen to separate contaminants like stickies and fines. Excessive dilution can pass unwanted material through, affecting drying and sheet quality. Managed using clear water dilution.

KEY VARIABLE: Dual Zone Wet Suction Box No.1 Separator Outlet Pressure Control MV | PIC-2032-612 MV (%)
DEFINITION: Controls vacuum pressure in the dual-zone wet suction box for effective sheet drainage. Balanced vacuum prevents sheet sealing and fines accumulation, ensuring smooth water removal.

KEY VARIABLE: Refiner No.1 Outlet Pressure Indication | PI-2018-202A (psi)
DEFINITION: Monitors pressure at Refiner #1's outlet to assess plate condition. Declining pressure indicates wear, reducing refining efficiency. Regular plate replacement ensures optimal fiber processing.

KEY VARIABLE: First Press Draw (fpm)
DEFINITION: Measures speed differential at the first press to ensure smooth sheet transfer from wire to combi press. Proper draw prevents weak points and sheet breaks. Typically ranges from 2-8 FPM.

KEY VARIABLE: Heat Recovery P.V. Fan No.2 Steam Coils Inlet Temperature Control | TIC-8075-201
DEFINITION: Regulates air temperature in the dryer hood to prevent condensation and improve drying efficiency. Hot air is circulated and reheated using steam coils, maintained at 190-195°F.

KEY VARIABLE: Refiner No.1 Inlet Pressure Indication | PI-2123-228 (psi)
DEFINITION: Ensures consistent pressure at Refiner #1's inlet for adequate fiber residence time. Proper pressure prevents uneven refining and maintains sheet quality. Typically maintained between 38-42 psi.

KEY VARIABLE: Second Section Draw (fpm)
DEFINITION: Measures the speed differential between the first press drive, pickup roll drive, and Nipco P roll drive. Influences sheet tension and strength, typically maintained between 26-30 fpm to ensure smooth transfer and minimize breaks.

KEY VARIABLE: Quaternary Forward Cleaners Rejects Flow Indication | FI-2118-209 (gpm)
DEFINITION: Tracks the reject flow from the quaternary forward cleaners, primarily removing sand and grit. Should be maintained between 120-140 GPM to ensure cleaner efficiency and minimize fiber loss.

KEY VARIABLE: Primary Reverse Flow Cleaners Flow Indication | FI-2022-111 (gpm)
DEFINITION: Monitors stock flow into the disk thickener, affecting production rates and stock storage levels. Consistency must be below 1% for optimal removal of stickies and wax, with a typical flow of ~13,300 GPM.

KEY VARIABLE: PM Excess WW Chest Level Indication | LI-2118-201 (%)
DEFINITION: Indicates the level of excess white water collected from various sources. Levels above 40% result in overflow to the buffer tank, requiring careful management to prevent rising mill basin levels.

KEY VARIABLE: Spill Containment Tank Level Control | LIC-2021-207
DEFINITION: Regulates overflow from the pulper island, recycling water back to the pulper or mill basin. The level is controlled to stay below 20% to prevent overflows.

KEY VARIABLE: Vacuum Sump Pit Level Control   | LIC-2336-103
DEFINITION: Monitors water levels in the vacuum seal pit, which collects water from various process points. Proper level control ensures vacuum efficiency and prevents excessive water discharge.

KEY VARIABLE: Canal Water Collection Tank Temperature Indiction | TI-2035-606 (deg F)
DEFINITION: Tracks the temperature of water exiting the vacuum seal pit heat exchanger. Helps regulate cooling tower operation, ensuring vacuum pumps function efficiently.

KEY VARIABLE: Atlas Copco Air Compressor Inlet Flow Transmitter | FI-8033-112 (gpm)
DEFINITION: Measures cooling water flow for the Atlas Copco air compressor, requiring 50-75 GPM. If flow drops below 20 GPM, the system switches to city water to prevent overheating.

KEY VARIABLE: Cooling Filtrate Water Pressure Control | PIC-6928-101
DEFINITION: Ensures stable filtrate water pressure for cooling applications. Proper control prevents heat exchange inefficiencies and potential system overheating.

KEY VARIABLE: Deculator Pressure Indication | PI-2118-206 (inHg)
DEFINITION: Monitors pressure in the Deculator, which removes air from stock before entering the headbox. Proper pressure control improves Concora performance by reducing air entrapment.

KEY VARIABLE: IR Compressor Cooling Water Flow Indication | FI-8033-107 (gpm)
DEFINITION: Tracks cooling water flow for the Ingersoll Rand compressor, which requires 50-75 GPM. Flow dropping below 20 GPM triggers a switch to city water.

KEY VARIABLE: Tertiary Fine Screen Rejects Flow Control  | FFIC-2017-403A (gpm)
DEFINITION: Regulates rejects from the tertiary fine screen, ensuring effective removal of contaminants like stickies and Styrofoam while minimizing fiber loss.

KEY VARIABLE: Refiner Outlet Freeness | AIC-2123-230 (CSF)
DEFINITION: Measures water retention capacity in refined stock using the Canadian Standard Freeness (CSF) scale. Higher values improve drainage but must be balanced for fiber bonding and sheet strength.

KEY VARIABLE: Concora Predicted-Raw
DEFINITION: Estimates Concora test values based on refining, fiber orientation, and draw settings. Used for quality control to ensure product meets strength standards.

KEY VARIABLE: RCT Predicted
DEFINITION: Predicts Ring Crush Test (RCT) values to optimize fiber alignment and refining intensity. Helps maintain required cross-directional strength for corrugated board applications.
